{"step_by_step_thinking": "Immunoglobulin receptors are produced by B cells and are not the most numerous in the genome. Interleukins are a type of cytokine, and while they do have many receptors, they are not the most numerous. Growth factors also have many receptors, but they are not the most numerous. Odorants, on the other hand, have a very large number of receptors in the genome. This is because there are many different types of odorants, and each one requires a different receptor.", "answer_choice": "D. Odorants"}
